intro: Cacalia erigerodes, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds.
